claim_object.outcome_concept: 7-day neonatal mortality (binary: infant died within 7 days of birth)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Deployment of a doctor to the health facility (Doctor Arm) vs control (no deployment)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of deploying a doctor to a primary health center on 7-day infant mortality
claim_object.target_population: Live births to women enrolled in the study at participating primary health centers in Kaduna State, Nigeria

baseline_specs.label: Table4-Col1
baseline_specs.notes: reghdfe mort7 mlp doctor, abs(strata) cl(fid). Both treatment arms included simultaneously.

baseline_specs.label: Table4-Col2
baseline_specs.notes: Table 4 Col 2: basic controls (cont_base = cont_ind + male) + quarter FE. Note: magedum and mschool are factor (categorical) variables.

constraints.mandatory_treatment_vars: Both mlp and doctor must be included together in the baseline and all RC specs (the paper always includes both arms). Exception: rc/data/treatment/doctor_only explicitly drops mlp.
constraints.control_variable_notes: cont_ind = cct i.magedum first hausa i.mschool auton car last gest; cont_base = cont_ind + male; cont_hc = hc_deliveries hc_cesarean hc_transfusion i.hc_clean; cont_all = cont_base + cont_hc + pastdeath hc_workers hc_open24hrs hc_equipment hc_beds hc_lab hc_drug hc_nopow hc_vent i.hc_cond
constraints.notes: RCT design. Table 4 shows 4 columns: no controls, basic controls, extended controls, and double-lasso. The control sets revealed are: none, cont_base (10 vars), cont_base+cont_hc (14+ vars), and double-lasso selected controls (from cont_all, ~25 vars).

exploration_universe.notes: high_dose and low_dose (Table 5) restrict to pregnancies with above/below-median exposure to the deployed provider. These change the target population and are heterogeneity analyses, not estimand-preserving RCs. doctor_arm_only drops the MLP arm entirely, restricting to Doctor vs Control facilities only (changes the comparison set and implicitly the population).

canonical.notes: Cluster SEs at the health facility level (randomization unit). Used throughout Table 4.

variants.notes: Cluster at strata level (coarser clustering). Note: small number of strata may make this unreliable.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table 1 balance across treatment arms (facility, mother, and child variables)
Tables A.2 and A.3: attrition characteristics and differential attrition by arm
